main.node

Class NominalDecisionNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.node.NominalDecisionNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Node

    public class NominalDecisionNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements Node
    This class implements the Node interface and is made to deal with Nominal data. Both types of decision nodes are intended to accept some data and make a decision that will help classify the data.
    Author:
    Dan Martin

      This constructs a NominalDecisionNode that will make a decision using the dataIndex and breakString.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NominalDecisionNode

        public NominalDecisionNode(java.lang.String breakString,
                           int dataIndex,
                           java.lang.String attribute)
        This constructs a NominalDecisionNode that will make a decision using the dataIndex and breakString.
        Parameters:
        breakString - if a dataPoint has this value at the correct index then it will route the data right.
        dataIndex - this is the index that the node will look to compare the breakString to.
        attribute - this is the name of the attribute that the node will be making decisions with.
